title: Kymeta secures $84 million to scale up antenna production
summary: Antenna maker Kymeta said March 15 it has raised $84 million to expand manufacturing facilities ahead of deploying its first flat panel, electronically steered user terminals for low Earth orbit (LEO) satellites this year.

title: Ukrainian space industry players continue work, eye European projects amid war
summary: While Russia’s invasion of Ukraine continues to impact the Ukrainian space sector, senior industry representatives say that local companies have so far managed to adapt their activities to the realities of war, and they are determined to advance joint projects with their European partners.

title: Watch live: Astronauts head outside space station to prep for new solar arrays
summary: Astronauts Kayla Barron and Raja Chari floated out of the International Space Station airlock for a spacewalk Tuesday to install brackets and struts to support new solar arrays to upgrade the research lab’s power system.

title: ISS astronauts conduct spacewalk as busy period of station operations begins
summary: Two NASA astronauts have begun a spacewalk to continue the process of upgrading the space station’s power systems, kicking off a busy period of upcoming operations amid the continued uncertainty over the future of Russian co-operation on the ISS.

title: NASA ready to roll out SLS
summary: NASA is ready to roll out the first Space Launch System rocket this week for a countdown rehearsal ahead of a launch later this year.
